title: What is the best type of business organization? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no “best” type of business structure. There’s easy to complex. Sole Prop: Straightforward and relatively simple to set up. However, the sole prop is personally liable for all debts and liabilities of the company. There is no legal protection as with other forms. Sole Prop can have only one owner. If you want to bring in another, you have to change structures. All profits/loses pass through to the owner’s personal tax returns.LLC (Limited Liability Company): Comes with substantial legal shields and protections to the members, very flexible in how it’s structured, requires additional documents and agreements which can be simple or complex depending on the specific situation. Tax reporting more complex but income and losses generally pass through to members personal returns.Corporations (S, C, etc). These offer the greatest protections but are the most complex to set up and manage. Very complex tax and legal implications to work out. Administration is most burdensome and expensive. Many instances of double taxation and regulatory headaches. The is the most common form of structure if one is seeking outside investment.
